sum_force_split.f90

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 !  ===================================================================
00002 !
00003 !                              SUM_FORCE
00004 !
00005 !   Calculate forces of particle from interaction list
00006 !
00007 !  ===================================================================
00008 
00009 subroutine sum_force_split( p, n, inode, eps, sumfx, sumfy, sumfz, sumphi, load )
00010   use treevars
00011   implicit none
00012   integer, intent(in) :: p  ! particle label 
00013   integer, intent(in) :: n  !  # terms on interaction list
00014   integer, dimension(1:n) ::  inode
00015   real, intent(in) :: eps ! smoothing parameter
00016   real, intent(out) :: load ! work load for particle p
00017   integer :: jnode, i,j,k, nq, nm 
00018 
00019   real*8 :: rd,dx,dy,dz,d,dx2,dy2,dz2 
00020   real*8 :: dx3,dy3,dz3,rd3,rd5,rd7,fd1,fd2,fd3,fd4,fd5,fd6
00021   real*8 :: fsx,fsy,fsz,phi
00022   real*8, dimension(n*10) :: mult
00023   real*8, dimension(n) :: qmon
00024   real*8, dimension(n*3) :: xmon, xquad
00025   real*8, intent(out) ::  sumfx,sumfy,sumfz,sumphi 
00026   real :: eps2
00027 
00028   eps2=eps**2
00029   sumfx = 0.
00030   sumfy = 0.
00031   sumfz = 0.
00032   sumphi = 0.
00033 
00034   ! copy multipole moments into stride 1 arrays
00035   nm=0
00036   nq=0
00037 
00038   do j=1,n
00039      jnode=inode(j)
00040      if (jnode>0) then
00041         nm=nm+1
00042         k = (nm-1)*3+1
00043         qmon(nm) = charge(jnode)
00044         xmon(k) = xcoc(jnode)
00045         xmon(k+1) = ycoc(jnode)
00046         xmon(k+2) = zcoc(jnode)
00047      else
00048         nq=nq+1
00049         i = (nq-1)*10+1
00050         k = (nq-1)*3+1
00051         xquad(k) = xcoc(jnode)
00052         xquad(k+1) = ycoc(jnode)
00053         xquad(k+2) = zcoc(jnode)
00054         mult(i) = charge(jnode)
00055         mult(i+1) = xdip(jnode)
00056         mult(i+2) = ydip(jnode)
00057         mult(i+3) = zdip(jnode)
00058         mult(i+4) = xxquad(jnode)
00059         mult(i+5) = yyquad(jnode)
00060         mult(i+6) = zzquad(jnode)
00061         mult(i+7) = xyquad(jnode)
00062         mult(i+8) = yzquad(jnode)
00063         mult(i+9) = zxquad(jnode)
00064      endif
00065   end do
00066 
00067 !  call delay(me,0)
00068 !  write(*,*) p,' x_p=',x(p)
00069 
00070 ! monopoles
00071   do j=1,nm
00072      
00073   !  preprocess distances
00074      k = 3*(j-1) + 1  ! coc index
00075      dx = x(p) - xmon(k)
00076      dy = y(p) - xmon(k+1)
00077      dz = z(p) - xmon(k+2) 
00078 
00079      d = sqrt(dx**2+dy**2+dz**2+eps2)
00080      rd = 1./d
00081      rd3 = rd**3
00082      sumphi = sumphi + qmon(j)*rd
00083      sumfx = sumfx + qmon(j)*dx*rd3
00084      sumfy = sumfy + qmon(j)*dy*rd3
00085      sumfz = sumfz + qmon(j)*dz*rd3
00086   end do
00087 
00088 ! Multipoles
00089   do j=1,nq
00090      
00091   !  preprocess distances
00092      i = 10*(j-1) + 1  ! multipole index
00093      k = 3*(j-1) + 1  ! coc index
00094      dx = x(p) - xquad(k)
00095      dy = y(p) - xquad(k+1)
00096      dz = z(p) - xquad(k+2) 
00097 
00098      d = sqrt(dx**2+dy**2+dz**2+eps2)
00099      rd = 1./d
00100      rd3 = rd**3
00101      rd5 = rd**5
00102      rd7 = rd**7
00103 
00104      dx2 = dx**2
00105      dy2 = dy**2
00106      dz2 = dz**2
00107      dx3 = dx**3
00108      dy3 = dy**3
00109      dz3 = dz**3
00110 
00111      fd1 = -3.*dx2*rd5 + rd3
00112      fd2 = -3.*dy2*rd5 + rd3
00113      fd3 = -3.*dz2*rd5 + rd3
00114      fd4 = -3.*dx*dy*rd5
00115      fd5 = -3.*dy*dz*rd5
00116      fd6 = -3.*dx*dz*rd5
00117 
00118      ! potential
00119 
00120      sumphi = sumphi + mult(i)*rd    &                           !  monopole term
00121           ! 
00122      + (dx*mult(i+1) + dy*mult(i+2) + dz*mult(i+3))*rd3  &    !  dipole 
00123      !        Dx             Dy            Dz
00124           -0.5*fd1*mult(i+4) - 0.5*fd2*mult(i+5) - 0.5*fd3*mult(i+6)  &  !  quadrupole
00125           !           Qxx                 Qyy                 Qzz
00126           + fd4*mult(i+7) + fd5*mult(i+8) + fd6*mult(i+9)      
00127      !             Qxy            Qyz             Qzx
00128 
00129      !  forces
00130 
00131      sumfx = sumfx + mult(i)*dx*rd3 &      ! monopole term
00132           !
00133      - ( fd1*mult(i+1) + fd4*mult(i+2) + fd6*mult(i+3) )  &   !  dipole term
00134           !
00135      + ( -9.*dx*rd5 + 15.*dx3*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+4) &
00136           + ( -3.*dy*rd5 + 15.*dy*dx2*rd7 )*mult(i+7) &
00137           + ( -3.*dz*rd5 + 15.*dz*dx2*rd7 )*mult(i+9) &   !   quadrupole term
00138           + ( 15*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+8) &
00139           + ( -3.*dx*rd5 + 15.*dx*dy2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+5) &
00140           + ( -3.*dx*rd5 + 15.*dx*dz2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+6) 
00141 
00142      sumfy = sumfy + mult(i)*dy*rd3 &
00143           - ( fd2*mult(i+2) + fd4*mult(i+1) + fd5*mult(i+3) ) &
00144           + ( -9.*dy*rd5 + 15.*dy3*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+5) &
00145           + ( -3.*dx*rd5 + 15.*dx*dy2*rd7 )*mult(i+7) &
00146           + ( -3.*dz*rd5 + 15.*dz*dy2*rd7 )*mult(i+8) &
00147           + ( 15.*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+9) &
00148           + ( -3.*dy*rd5 + 15.*dy*dx2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+4) &
00149           + ( -3.*dy*rd5 + 15.*dy*dz2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+6) 
00150 
00151      sumfz = sumfz + mult(i)*dz*rd3 &
00152           - ( fd3*mult(i+3) + fd5*mult(i+2) + fd6*mult(i+1) ) &
00153           + ( -9.*dz*rd5 + 15.*dz3*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+6) &
00154           + ( -3.*dx*rd5 + 15.*dx*dz2*rd7 )*mult(i+9) &
00155           + ( -3.*dy*rd5 + 15.*dy*dz2*rd7 )*mult(i+8) &
00156           + ( 15.*dx*dy*dz*rd7 )*mult(i+7) &
00157           + ( -3.*dz*rd5 + 15.*dz*dy2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+5) &
00158           + ( -3.*dz*rd5 + 15.*dz*dx2*rd7 )*0.5*mult(i+4) 
00159 
00160 !     write(*,'(i5,a5,f12.3,a5,f12.3,a5,f12.3)') jnode,' q_j=',charge(jnode),' x_j=',xcoc(jnode),' d=',d
00161 
00162   end do
00163 
00164   ! work load - can make this for accurate by sorting leaf/twig terms
00165 
00166   work(p) = n    ! store for next domain decomp
00167   load = work(p)  ! return to calling routine
00168 end subroutine sum_force_split
00169
